result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric T. Mineau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric T. Mineau in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:46
Schiek/RIchards/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing - 
Court imposes and stays WSP for  10 years -   4  in/  6 ES and POP for 6 years- credit for - TBD if revoked
CC/CV/Supervision fees/DNA surcharge  - 9 months jail with huber for all purposes -commence on/before 9-19 8am -  Submit DNA sample - any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

from DOC re due date for PSI
Amended

11:25 a.m. Defendant Eric T. Mineau in court with attorney Steven G. Richards. Mary Margaret Sowinski, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire & waiver filed. Richards statement to agreement/resolution. State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct. 1 and add Ct. 2, 948.04(1) to the Information - counsel request pre-sentence report. State bound by recommendations; defense free to argue. Sowinski statement--references s. 973.048/reporting. Richards statement. Court statement - grants State's motion. Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 2. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Court orders presentence. Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

11:08 a.m. Defendant Eric T. Mineau in court with attorney Steven G. Richards. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek - no resolution reached at this time/complicated. Counsel to meet with computer analyst/expert for further information. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.
States Reply to Discovery
Pre-trial conference at 04-05-2016 11:00 am
Pre-trial conference at 02-09-2016 11:00 am
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

1:36 p.m. Defendant Eric T. Mineau in court with attorney Steven G. Richards via telephone with leave of Court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court question defendant about non-appearance.  Defendant states he had 3 teeth pulled and forgot about court date.  Court quashes warrant. Richards in receipt of Information - Michlig hands copy of Information to Defendant - Richards enters not guilty plea. Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Arraignment at 10-08-2015 01:30 pm

3:11 p.m. Attorney Steven G. Richards in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Richards states he does not know where defendant is - defendant was made aware of date at last hearing. Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 3:12 p.m.

2:09 p.m. Defendant Eric T. Mineau in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has not filed Information - evidence still in crime lab. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Bail continued. Adj. 2:11 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 09-16-2015 02:00 pm

3:54 pm Defendant Eric T. Mineau in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant regarding attorney.  Defendant states he has been told he is eligible for public defender - has been assigned PD from Green Bay - he could not make it today. Attorney Voorhees appears and states Attorney Richards has been appointed. Attorney Voorhees states his office will contact Attorney Richards. Bail continued  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

02:45 pm - Defendant Eric T. Mineau in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states contacted Hank Schultz and a couple of others, unable to come up with retainer.  Court adjourns and refers defendant to PD's office. Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

3:34 pm - Defendant Eric T. Mineau in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states Hank Schultz will represent.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
may not use computer at work or at home

01:50  pm - Defendant Eric T. Mineau in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Schiek/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned 01:55 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
